intro: Tridianisia chapelieri, commonly known as the chapelier's tridianisia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentapetalous flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
